alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 3:30PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ABOVE FREEZING TEMPERATURES FOR SOUTHWEST ALASKA THIS WEEKEND THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK... A series of low pressure systems will bring warm and windy conditions to the area Saturday through Monday. The first low pressure system will increase temperatures to the 20s and 30s with Sunday and Monday continuing to warm in the 30s and 40s. The Kuskokwim Delta will see the warmest conditions with highs in the lower 40s on Sunday and Monday. Bristol Bay and the Kuskokwim valley can expect temperatures in the mid to upper 30s. Strong winds are also expected across the Kuskokwim Delta with gusts near 50 mph along coastal locations with the strongest winds expected on Sunday. The rest of the area will experience light winds. These strong winds may cause water to come over the ice along coastal locations.

area.areaDesc: Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley
